website_summaries.verdict: The Canon EF-M 22mm f/2 STM, the standard prime lens for the EOS M, is compact, fast, and sharp.

customer_reviews.title: Really Recommend It
customer_reviews.text: For the price I love the portraits it takes and how sharp it is compared the kit lens 15-45mm of my Canon M50.
customer_reviews.author: M&A Shopping

customer_reviews.title: Compact and packs a punch
customer_reviews.text: Bought this prime lens for my Canon M50. I’m an amateur and no where close to pro and this camera just made everything look great. Used manual settings in all the photos. I was on a ship without a tripod and the fireworks turned out great. Have not used it indoors night time but so far this is great for both landscape and portrait.
customer_reviews.author: A Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: good lens with some issues
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, sharp lens. Edit on Dec. 29, 2018: After some trying and testing, I found that the lens is indeed very sharp but tends to create a fair amount of flaring and ghosting, probably because it is so short and doesn't have a lens hood. So, it is good for landscape and similar stuff as long as you're not photographing against the sun or other sources of light. Therefore, I downgraded it from five to four stars.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoguyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great Selfie len.
customer_reviews.text: Finding the perfect focus a bit difficult, but once it is in focus then the pictures are perfect. Love the size of it, and is the item travel lenses companion for your M50 camera. I am glad I bought it used because it saved me money, and so far it has been working just fine. No image stabilization, but that is a canon issue. The product match seller description of it perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Li1976

customer_reviews.title: Finally got the lens and so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Finally got the lens after the first one I ordered never arrived and Amazon didn’t reimburse me so I took a big it. Not fair at all to me. But got this lens and tested it briefly and liked the image quality and blurred back or foreground were very noticeable and nice. Will need to do further tests and update the review. For now the focus motor makes mallet noise, but it doesn’t affect me since like using an external mic when recording video.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lens for traveling!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens for my Canon M3 mirrorless camera and I absolutely love it. It's the perfect lens for traveling. It doesn't add much to the camera so it's easy to throw in a purse. I love having the wider lens for landscape photos but it's also great for portraits and details. The 2.0 aperture is great for shooting in low light and also getting a nice depth of field when focusing on people or objects. I highly recommend this lens for canon's mirrorless cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Hayth

customer_reviews.title: Great Main Lens for M series
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful addition and really a good workaround lens! I use this on my Canon M100 for lightweight travel and never really use the kit anymore. Ive used it for 2 trips so far and it makes a small camera even smaller. Overall good lens if you're looking for easy to use, lightweight and manageable especially for on the to travel.
customer_reviews.author: Suzuka

customer_reviews.title: Compact, versatile lens.
customer_reviews.text: For my new Canon M50, I tried a 32mm prime lens with an adapter ring and did not like the bulk. Returned them and bought this 22mm lens. I love it. It's small and light and I can slip the camera right into my jacket pocket. Focuses quite close as shown in the first two photos. These are both quick practice shots right after attaching it to the camera. The last picture shows this morning's fog and drizzle outside a local restaurant—just a quick snapshot before breakfast.
customer_reviews.author: seatlanta

customer_reviews.title: Go-To lens for my M5
customer_reviews.text: I carry the kit lens with me still, but i rarely use it. I got the M5 so i didnt feel the need to carry my larger setups and risk breaking my main money-makers while out hiking or camping This lens is the nifty50 of the mirrorless world for me. It rarely leaves the camera! An easy purchase, for sure
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E. Sennett

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Great lens for low light & blurry backgrounds. Compact. Great auto focus. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Light and Bright
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic light weight lens on my Canon M5. Very handy and I can take it everywhere. Takes sharp photos. I wish it had image stabilizer for really dark situation. That might have made it heavy though. So no complain. Suffers from purple fringing that needs to be corrected in post processing. Overall nice lens for the price. Attached pictures are directly out of camera without processing.
customer_reviews.author: Canon User

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is easily one of the best lenses Canon has ever made for their Mirrorless system. Highly Recommend if you want this focal length.
customer_reviews.author: Miltz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent prime for EOS-M
customer_reviews.text: Must have lens for the EOS-M line. Not image stabilized but that's not a big problem with the low light capability. short length makes for a very compact travel camera. As everyone else has said, tack sharp and cheap!
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Grumling

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens, can take very sharp photos, great performance in low light situations
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Very cool
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cool compact lens with an unusual optical design - the front element is concave. It is a very sharp lens and on the M3 camera is very handy for travel. Only one deficiency - I wish it had image stabilization. Canon just announced a macro 28mm lens which will have IS; this will be the first prime (non-zoom) M series lens with IS. I have a preorder in for that.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor.Generosity

customer_reviews.title: Possibly the best lens for the Canon M50
customer_reviews.text: This lens is multi purpose, could shoot wide, macro and even for vlogging. A beast when it comes to low light. Pretty sure you'll get a quality that competes with higher-end cameras if you use this lens.
customer_reviews.author: AhmadTarek23

customer_reviews.title: Ef-m system MUST OWN
customer_reviews.text: If you have a Canon M mount system. This lens is 10, 000% a must own. Fair price and a stellar lens for the system. This and the 35 mm are recommendable primes for the M mount system. You won't regret this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well built, sharp, small!
customer_reviews.text: Well built, sharp, small! I worried that the STM motor would be heard in video but that has not been the case. Great lens for walking around.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great every day lens for the Canon M series
customer_reviews.text: Freaking awesome lens for the Canon M line up. It compliments a 50mm nicely. You can get some nice close up portraits as well as epic landscapes. The BEST part is the size - it is so small that my Canon M3 looks like a point and shoot with this lens!
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for video (fixed set-up)
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for vlogging, mostly staying stationary (fixed-spot), on a Canon M50. The video image quality is excellent. Produces nice soft backgrounds. The only down fall for shooting videos on "the go"... it lacks on-board image stabilization.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: M3 + 22mm f/2
customer_reviews.text: I imported an M3 body from Japan and picked up one of these. Love it so far! Great little lens.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Cardwell

customer_reviews.title: S H A R P
customer_reviews.text: This lens is pretty 🔥 and I'd say more for video than photo, though it has a lot going for it as far as "the one lens if I had to" scenario (though I think it's a dash strange length at 22m for JUST photos). It's incredibly sharp, as said. slickly made as most all canon stuff.
customer_reviews.author: paulfujita

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal!
customer_reviews.text: This lens is a must have for any kit. I use it to film all of my YouTube videos and to shoot close photos. Really liking how everything looks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This lens deserves five stars
customer_reviews.text: It certainly puts out a sharp image with plenty of contrast. It is small enough to fit in my pocket on the camera and it doesn't cost an arm and a leg. ThEre's no IS, but at this focal length it's really not necessary. I can't say it's absolutely my best lens, but it is close in performance at a fraction of the price. If I didn't include price and size in my rating, this would be a 4 star lens(based on IQ). No regrets with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DanTheMan

customer_reviews.title: ... original M and find it to be a very nice lens. It's sharp and compact
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my original M and find it to be a very nice lens. It's sharp and compact, making it great for a walk around lens when you don't want to carry something bulkier. I have no complaints and glad I added it to my kit.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Low profile, sturdy, and takes great low-light photos!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most compact lens for the Canon EOS M camera, and it's low profile is amazing for travel and compactness! It takes good, clear photos and does incredibly well in low light! The aluminum body is sleek and solid. The used model I purchased was in great condition, other than arriving late.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little lens. The image quality is very good. One of the best M lens there is.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Hasel

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: No IS on this lens, which is no problem as it was never advertised to have it. Auto-focus is perfect for video. I love the wide open aperture of 2. I’m rather new to photography and I like experimenting with bokeh. A great price for my first lens other than the kit lens on the M50.
customer_reviews.author: akaharu

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Can juat abor do a 3 person selfies with this. I am 5"3 and have semi short arms.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: An amazing lense for the price
customer_reviews.text: Such a great lense. Especially for photos. The lense doesn't have image stabilizers which is kind of a bummer, but not such a huge problem.
customer_reviews.author: Paulo Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Good lens
customer_reviews.text: Great lens. Some may be interested in this lens' lens flare effect. I'm attaching a sample (shot on an EOS M2). Not a very artistic flare effect, but I've only encountered it on this occasion of shooting a sunset. Other sunsets have turned out with no flare.
customer_reviews.author: Occasional Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Quiet!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this lense. It has a decent wide angle and focus noise is so quiet, 'it cannot be heard on video at all! I really love that it's so sleek and make the camera seem a bit more compact. I was afraid of what the used product would look like but it's in pristine condition.
customer_reviews.author: Toya Dorsey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Lens
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens purchased directly from Amazon, great a usual. This is the best lens I got for my M camera, fast, compact, and very sharp. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Great first lens!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first lens since I’ve purchased the M50. I mainly use it for b-roll and portrait/street photography. You won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Jose Rios

customer_reviews.title: Lens did not work
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed. Put the lens on the camera, and all it did was make weird clicking noises and no picture. I moved the lens slightly off the white mark, and a fuzzy picture was shown. What a waste of time. Obviously will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: dlee

customer_reviews.title: Great wide-angle for M-series cameras
customer_reviews.text: This is a compact, sharp, fast wide angle lens for the M-series cameras. I think this is my favorite lens actually - I always carry it. REALLY tiny!!!
customer_reviews.author: tangodancer

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Wow this lens brought the M50 to life. Amazing pictures and sharp video quality. A must have lens for ef-m line.
customer_reviews.author: N. Leon

customer_reviews.title: Sharp as a tack
customer_reviews.text: Fast and accurate auto focus. Very very sharp. Build quality commensurate with the price.
customer_reviews.author: Karen E Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Incredible lens. Very sharp and accurate. I can see why its price doesnt go down much from MSRP.
customer_reviews.author: zip-it

customer_reviews.title: Great things come in small packages
customer_reviews.text: This lens is fantastic. Not only does it barely increase the footprint of your camera body, it provides a fantastic image with a great depth of feel. This is my go to lens now and I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail A. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: This pancake takes great photos and videos
customer_reviews.text: Good lens all around great for photo in tight corridors or spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison McGuire

customer_reviews.title: great for travel
customer_reviews.text: If I were to choose one lens for my Canon M series this would be it. Fast and with a very versatile focal length for walk around photography. Excellent for travel photography, very small compact and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: JJI

customer_reviews.title: Great lens! Canon put great effort into the EOS ...
customer_reviews.text: Great lens! Canon put great effort into the EOS M and the lenses - the same quality I have found in the L series. Great vendor as well - very responsive to questions and offered great customer experience!
customer_reviews.author: Vardon

customer_reviews.title: Good Used Lens
customer_reviews.text: Bought used, item came in good condition. Great lens with good image quality for the size. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mrmcgrew

customer_reviews.title: Such a fantastic lens for the price
customer_reviews.text: I thought the standard 18-55mm was decent for the EOS M but wow this thing is an absolute beast. It is super compact and very sharp. I am far from a photographer but this made taking pictures a lot more fun.
customer_reviews.author: Abhishek Bhatnagar

customer_reviews.title: The EOS M should have come with this
customer_reviews.text: This is the lens that the EOS M should have come with. It's my go to lens for everyday general shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Eaton

customer_reviews.title: A fine tiny lens but not silent.
customer_reviews.text: Optically this little lens is terrific being quite sharp even wide open and super sharp stopped down. It's not quite silent like the 18-55 M.
customer_reviews.author: Wackezoid

customer_reviews.title: "L" lens!
customer_reviews.text: Quite simply, the best walk-around lens for the EF-M bodies! Just as sharp as any "L" lens!
customer_reviews.author: Staticlag

customer_reviews.title: nice lens
customer_reviews.text: The image quality is good. The auto-focus is quiet, and the small size makes it my main lens. The fast f2 makes it a good low-light combination with the Canon EOS M camera it is specifically designed for.
customer_reviews.author: nom de plume

customer_reviews.title: Good little lens
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty much the equivalent of a 35mm lens on a normal SLR, and it performs well. I like it more than the zoom lens that is also available.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Product was as described!
customer_reviews.text: I like how the product came in great shape! Almost like new!
customer_reviews.author: Jerica Trinidad

customer_reviews.title: A very useful lens for CanonM
customer_reviews.text: Small lens that produces very sharp pictures for the investment at f2.0. It was a very useful add on especially in settings that are poorly lit.
customer_reviews.author: Rocko

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: I use this more than the lens that came with it, great quality
customer_reviews.author: Nebey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Crazy sharp lens - brings new life to Canon EOS M. These two are the match made in Heaven!
customer_reviews.author: Mirza Hasanefendic

customer_reviews.title: Great lens!
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens! It works super well and has a great DOF. :)
customer_reviews.author: Aaron G. Randall

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, great price. Makes the M pocketable. Nice sharp, fast prime for the M
customer_reviews.author: tmwag

customer_reviews.title: Canon EF-M 22mm f2 STM Compact System Lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens. It produces a very sharp image and the f2 is great for low light photos.
customer_reviews.author: Charles B Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sharp and produces nice 35mm (full frame) images at F2
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: One amazing lens. You have to see the quality of the pictures to believe. Just amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Cakmak

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens, perfect working order
customer_reviews.text: Didn't come in a fancy box but the lens is working great and the image quality is fantastic. Nice and compact, with very lovely DOF effects. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Tsang

customer_reviews.title: 35mm Equivalent
customer_reviews.text: Over the years 35mm (on a 35mm camera) has become my favorite focal length to walk around with so I'm thrilled with this 22mm standard lens which is equivalent to a 35mm lens (on a Full Frame camera). If Canons regular standard lens for their EOS M was the equivalent to a 50mm (on a 35mm camera) I probably wouldn't have bought the EOS M. BTW, this lens is pleasingly sharp, you shouldn't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: like the simplicity Really nothing more can be said. Just point, auto focus and shoot. Great pictures with little effort
customer_reviews.author: Donald Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Works on the new Canon EOS M3
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens for my new Canon EOS M3. I love the depth of field and the blurry backgrounds of this 'pancake' lens. It's easy to snap this lens on your camera body.
customer_reviews.author: jeroena

customer_reviews.title: A fast (for the system), sharp little lens that ...
customer_reviews.text: A fast (for the system), sharp little lens that pumps out phenomenal results. If you have the eos m and can tolerate the superbly slow AF, then this is a must have.
customer_reviews.author: NotMarkTwain

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: This lens is a must have for any one with an EOS M I cant say enough about how great the photos come out in any lighting condition.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Very solid, compact, and good performance
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied by this lens. Although it looks very small and compact, but performance is pretty good. f/2 aperture is good for out-focusing. Highly recommended for portrait photos. I love EOS-M and EF-M lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Taisup Hwang

customer_reviews.title: Good lens
customer_reviews.text: Mount seems a little tight. The 18-55 fits much better. Not sure if the lens is re-furb, used, or new. Unsure what "white box" means. Came with no Canon literature or packaging. Lens works well and takes a clear bright pic. I guess the low price is why it came the way it did. All that's left is to go on a picture taking trip and test it against my Olympus E-PL1.
customer_reviews.author: David Simmonds

customer_reviews.title: Small and Sharp
customer_reviews.text: This should be the first choice lens for Canon EOS M CSC camera. Very sharp and to the point. Highly recommended for all Canon EOS M users.
customer_reviews.author: S. hanif

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all round prime
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens, compact and very sharp. Can be used as a prime for indoor and outdoor use.
customer_reviews.author: Dr N Mohindra

customer_reviews.title: One of the best Canon lenses ever
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely stunning lens! It's worth buying M3 simply so that you could use this lens. Sharp from f2 and beats my full frame 6D with 17-40 L glass even wide open. This is one of the best Canon lenses ever.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: one of the best lenses on the market I think
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolutely stellar lens; one of the best lenses on the market I think. It cannot be beaten for the price. As a very fast lens, even an amateur with a relatively inexpensive M-series Canon can take pictures with intense bokeh. Tiny, and it fits well in your pocket. There are quite a few reviews out there extolling this benefits of this lens; believe everything you read, it is truly excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Sherwin A.

customer_reviews.title: sharp pictures !!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm getting very sharp pictures and I'm very happy with this little lens (even being a bit slow to focus sometimes).
customer_reviews.author: Flavio Luiz Matangrano

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice little prime lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little prime lens. Sharp, but I had hoped it would focus fast like my EF prime lenses. Perhaps it is the EOS-M camera firmware, but still a bit slow.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew E. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: A little beast.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little pancake for the price! Easily worth maybe twice (maybe even a little more) price. Great bokeh and pretty darn quiet in video mode. Definitley will purchase again if I damage or break it out in the field.
customer_reviews.author: A.Y.

customer_reviews.title: Great lens.
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculously sharp lens for the price. At f/2.0 the bokeh is ridiculous. I'll be honest, I've never owned an actual quality camera before, so most of this is new to me, but it is a HUGE step up from a point and shoot lens and cost me around the same as a high-end point and shoot for the camera and lens, + or - $100.
customer_reviews.author: C. Fortune

customer_reviews.title: Not as sharp as I had hoped but with this ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as sharp as I had hoped but with this mounted the EOS M fits in my pocket. Worth the roughly $100 they are selling for at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Super Sharp Lens... Must have for EOS-M Cameras
customer_reviews.text: This lens with the Canon EOS-M is simply remarkable! Sharp, sharp, sharp and greak Bokeh!
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyITop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: GET IT ALREADY
customer_reviews.text: Lens is great, filter size is so small it's expensive, AF motor is a bit slow. BUT WHO CARES it's just so tiny and cute and sharp!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: this is a great lens i find the sharpness for video great at F2.2
customer_reviews.author: Juan Carlos Martinez

customer_reviews.title: This lens is perfect for regular photos
customer_reviews.text: This lens is perfect for regular photos, just keep in mind that there is no zoom. But again, as long as you're pretty close then it takes good pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer W

customer_reviews.title: Nice lens
customer_reviews.text: Nice lens for my EOS M. I wish it had manual focus but no major complaints. :)
customer_reviews.author: Eddrik

customer_reviews.title: just go for it if u have a canon eos M
customer_reviews.text: great lens for the price its almost always on my eos M a must have if u have the M
customer_reviews.author: montassar

customer_reviews.title: What I expected, in the best way possible.
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, if you go for the Canon EOS M, you really ought to own both lenses as there are only two native lenses out. While I contemplated buying a lens adapter for the bigger and bulkier pro-style lense, I'm quite pleased with the mix of the 18-55mm and this 22mm. Great at capturing pictures in low light, and the pancake lens with your EOS M really makes it a truly portable DSLR level shooter.
customer_reviews.author: sokokyu

customer_reviews.title: f/2.0 35mm equivalent on a full frame
customer_reviews.text: It creates a shallow depth of field, perfect for making bokehs and "wide-angled-portraitures/macro". My only problem with it is that AF and MF is very, very, very noisy! Canon even claimed that it's STM technology is virtually zero noise, but this one's really noisy. I'm not sure if it's a factory defect because I got it on a "grey market".
customer_reviews.author: Customer July 2012

customer_reviews.title: Neat little lens for EOS M
customer_reviews.text: Compact lens and a must have addition for EOS M owners....makes the camera really portable.
customer_reviews.author: Traveller DB

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Fit
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to purchase this lens for my M100 and looking forward to taking it out for a spin. Alas, like other reviewers have reported here and on other sites, the lens did not fit the camera properly. It didn't twist and click on like the 15-45mm lens---it had to be forced. I returned the lens and may try another one in the future. I really like the M100, though.
customer_reviews.author: Jon P.

customer_reviews.title: No Warranty!
customer_reviews.text: First, let me say, the lens itself seems fine. My test shots have been clear and I am satisfied. The reason for the low rating is that this Canon lens was delivered in a unmarked cardboard box wrapped in plastic missing any documentation whatsoever. It's either a fake or its gray market, therefore Canon will not honor any warranty. The seller needs to explain this as the advertisement does not indicate it is gray.
customer_reviews.author: Gadz

customer_reviews.title: Compact but not best quality
customer_reviews.text: First tests of this lens are a bit disappointing as image quality is not as good as expected. Still, because it is a fixed focal length, pancake-style lens, it makes my Canon M3 as compact as possible and delivers better image quality than a smart phone - just not as good as expected.
customer_reviews.author: James Guilford

customer_reviews.title: Aperture f/2!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great little low light lens, low profile, nice to have the f/2, good as a second lens though, 22mm is pretty wide for all uses...
customer_reviews.author: donie333

customer_reviews.title: ... it didn't fit my Rebel even though it was recommended as a fit
customer_reviews.text: I had to return as it didn't fit my Rebel even though it was recommended as a fit.
customer_reviews.author: Denis J. OSullivan

customer_reviews.title: Not clearly advertised as white box no warranty item
customer_reviews.text: Canon EF-M 22mm F2 STM Compact SystemLens from Mid West Photo comes in white box no warranty card or canon lens pouch obviously grey market at the very least (or worse)
customer_reviews.author: Adam H.

customer_reviews.title: Check to make sure it will work with your camera
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure the lens works fine however it didn't fit with my DSLR T3i Cannon. Would have helped if I would have double checked that!
customer_reviews.author: Kati S.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a fixed size lens...not a wide angle. I need the 11-18mm...
customer_reviews.author: nursekerrie85

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I am not a photog, therefore I did not realize that when I purchased this lens, it would not fit on my camera. I love Amazon's new feature that allows me to identify whether or not a particular lens will actually fit my camera, but that feature wasn't available when I first purchased this lens. Anyway, it turns out that this particular lens does not work with my Canon Rebel T3. I checked the advertisement again, and it does turn out that the seller indicated that this was compatible with digital SLR cameras. It wasn't with mine
customer_reviews.author: MrLeeInSanFrancisco

customer_reviews.title: I love it the quality is great and the image you get with this product is just excellent.
customer_reviews.text: I love it the quality is great and the image you get with this product is just excellent. i highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rosmery M Then

customer_reviews.title: love eos m
customer_reviews.text: Nice lens - lets a lot of light in, focuses fast and easy and isn't too bulky. I find myself shooting with it more than the 18-55mm so it was a great deal at $99.
customer_reviews.author: sdanzzz

product_meta.title: Canon EF-M 22mm f2 STM Compact System Lens
product_meta.description:
Ultra slim and compact, the new EF-M 22mm f/2 STM is the EOS M Digital Camera’s moderate wide-angle lens that’s small and light enough to carry everywhere. Its bright f/2.0 lens aperture works well with the EOS M Digital Camera’s large sensor to provide exceptional low-light performance, as well as create beautiful background blur in portraits. An aspheric lens element delivers high resolution and high contrast. For moviemakers, the EF-M 22mm f/2 STM utilizes a built-in stepping motor to provide smooth and quiet continuous autofocus when shooting video with the Canon EOS M Digital Camera. A circular aperture (7 blades) delivers soft-focus backgrounds and a short minimum focusing distance of only 5.9 inches (0.15 meters) allows you to get closer to your subjects.
